page.title: 10MARCHAM MILL
page.content:
Domesday Book said there was a mill in Marcham. Mrs Jones lives in the mill now. She said there was a Saxon mill which was called "Wulfmere's Mill". It was then called "Werg Mill". Werg means Willow.
The mill was a corn mill. It stopped being used about 1900.
In the land around the mill the spring water is salt although it is 60 miles from the sea. The Marcham mill owners used to have to go to the village to get proper water and walk all the way back to the mill.Mrs Jones told us that a lot of salt flowers grow near the mill. One of these is wild celery, and the name Marcham means "the riverside meadow where the wild celery grows".
